data.title: Windows Test fail: ExtHostTypes URI, toJSON
data.body:
```
    AssertionError: { scheme: 'file',
  authority: '',
  path: '/path/test.file',
  fsPath: '\\path\\test.file',
  query: '',
  fragment: '',
  exte deepEqual { '$mid': 1,
  scheme: 'file',
  authority: '',
  path: '/path/test.file',
  fsPath: '\\path/test.file',
  query: '',
  fragment
      + expected - actual

         "$mid": 1
         "authority": ""
         "external": "file:///path/test.file"
         "fragment": ""
      -  "fsPath": "\\path\\test.file"
      +  "fsPath": "\\path/test.file"
         "path": "/path/test.file"
         "query": ""
         "scheme": "file"
       }

      at Context.<anonymous> (C:\GitDevelopment\monaco\out\vs\workbench\test\node\api\extHostTypes.test.js:16:20)
      at callFn (C:\GitDevelopment\monaco\node_modules\mocha\lib\runnable.js:315:21)
      at Test.Runnable.run (C:\GitDevelopment\monaco\node_modules\mocha\lib\runnable.js:308:7)
      at Runner.runTest (C:\GitDevelopment\monaco\node_modules\mocha\lib\runner.js:422:10)
      at C:\GitDevelopment\monaco\node_modules\mocha\lib\runner.js:533:12
      at next (C:\GitDevelopment\monaco\node_modules\mocha\lib\runner.js:342:14)
      at C:\GitDevelopment\monaco\node_modules\mocha\lib\runner.js:352:7
      at next (C:\GitDevelopment\monaco\node_modules\mocha\lib\runner.js:284:14)
      at Immediate._onImmediate (C:\GitDevelopment\monaco\node_modules\mocha\lib\runner.js:320:5)
```

data.title: Feature request: Resize grip on find/replace popup
data.body:
Sometimes, when I do a find and replace, the text I want to find or replace may be longer than the width of the UI component and before I click the replace button I'd like to review that bit of text. 

Unfortunately, the find/replace UI has a fixed size, meaning I cannot resize it making reviewing the text cumbersome.

Compare the find/replace UI in Visual Studio Code

![find_replace_vscode](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/563860/12774373/5510e754-ca98-11e5-9af9-87d1f536091c.PNG)

With the same UI in full Visual Studio has a resize grip on the bottom left corner

![find_replace_vsfull](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/563860/12774375/55e41ba6-ca98-11e5-9b1c-9967c6263437.PNG)

![code_2016-02-03_03-20-36](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/75278/12770939/3c28be9c-ca25-11e5-8007-b3ef2d8b267e.png)

data.title: Files missing on workspace
data.body:
This happened on an Alpha version of VS Code.
Some files weren't appearing on the workspace in VS Code. This happened just after I added those same files to the .gitignore file.
I thought that maybe VS Code was trying to be really smart, and was auto-excluding the files that I put on .gitignore, so I removed them from the .gitignore file, but I still wasn't able to see the files in the workspace. I checked by using "Reveal in explorer", and the files where really there. After closing and re-opening VS Code I was able to see the files.

I'm not sure if it's related or not, but I was trying to use those files for source mapping with the node debugger, and the source mapping wasn't working at that moment either (as if the node debugger was also unable to see those files).

The issue happened only once, and I don't know how to reproduce it.

data.title: Word-wrapping doesn't work properly when a proportional font is used

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body: It's wrapping at the wrong place. I'm assuming the line measurement is happening based on character counts rather than the sum of the character widths? This doesn't work so well for us proportional font coders ;-)

data.title: Can't highlight an empty line
Bad TypeScript example at your docs page
Column guide
data.body:
I do a fair bit of editing in Markdown, and I like to hard-wrap blocks of text at column 120 (as opposed to the visual wrapping that happens in VSCode based on the editor.wrappingColumn setting).  

It would be really helpful to have a visual guide at a user-defined column number.  This visual guide would affect nothing, it would merely appear as a faintly visible vertical line that shows where the specified column is, such as column 120.  That way, when I'm writing large blocks of text, I don't have to constantly look down to the column number indicator to see where I should be hard-wrapping the text.

data.title: Add -h/-v command line args and linux/mac launch scripts
data.body: Fixes #378

data.title: Fixes to C++ and C syntax
data.body:
alignof and alignas are now C++ keywords.
friend and override as well as the method modifier const are now C++ only.
.H headers are now associated with C++.

data.title: boolean is highlighted incorrectly in JavaScript
data.body:
It should not be highlighted when called as a function.

![screen shot 2016-02-02 at 10 54 31 am](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2193314/12760469/5e2422b4-c99b-11e5-8b95-33a0eee7f445.png)

In all 3 cases above, `boolean` is scoped as `storage.type.js.ts`, `other` is scoped as `js`.

data.title: Search: no a11y feedback for search results and search progress
data.body:
- when no results are found, we need to indicate this
- when search is done we should indicate this with the number of results

Can try to use `role="status"` for this purpose.

data.title: Go to Definition is not working for simple js object
Add an option to ignore YAML front-matter data when previewing

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
It would be nice if Markdown preview would ignore the YAML front-matter.

An example:

``` md

---
title: my first post
date: 2016-01-18
tags: stuff, other stuff

---

# My first post

Hello world, this is my first post.
```

The preview would start at `# My first post`.

data.title: High contrast theme
data.body:
We need to start thinking about high contrast support in VS Code for GA. Some thoughts:
- do we need the theme for all OS or only Windows?
- our current high contrast theme for Windows is lagging behind our new features and was not updated in more than a year
- do we need to adjust the contrast for our current themes also, or is a high contrast theme good enough

@chrisdias @bgashler1 fyi

data.title: VS Dark + (default) theme not picked up
data.body: @aeschli not sure if this is intentional, but the new default theme is not being used if you update from 0.10.6 to 0.10.7 because the theme has a different name ('vs-dark' compared to 'vs-dark vscode-theme-colorful-defaults-themes-dark_plus-tmTheme')

data.title: [0.10.7] input box empty value returns `undefined`
data.body:
When using the insiders version, I noticed my `vscode-yo` plugin isn't working correctly anymore. The reason is that just pressing enter returns value `undefined` while in the previous versions it returned an empty string. This way it's not possible to make a difference between the user pressing <kbd>Esc</kbd> and <kbd>enter</kbd>.

// @bpasero

data.title: [0.10.7-insider] Salsa does not honor JSDoc for object methods
[0.10.7-insider] Intellisense with Salsa shows the argument which is the closure compiler style generics in jsdoc as `any` type at the caller place
